original_title: Sri Lanka rupee stronger at Rs314/318 to US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka rupee was quoted stronger at 314/318 rupees to the US dollar Wednesday, up from 318/320 on Monday dealers said.
Sri Lanka’s central bank is operating broadly deflationary open market operations supportive of a stronger rupee, but has an ad hoc exchange rate policy.

The ad hoc policy involves flipping regime from a peg to buy dollars (strong side convertibility) and suddenly staying away and avoid providing weak side convertibility, effectively flipping the regime to a float.

The collapsing currency was reigned in by moral suasion twice so far this year. However if monetary policy is inflationary (money is printed to cut rates claiming inflation is low after credit picks up) the rupee will tend to depreciate.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2030 was quoted at 13.70/13.90 percent down from Monday’s close at 13.80/14.00 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2028 was quoted at 13.80/14.00 percent from closing at 13.95/14.10 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 14.45/60 percent steady from closing at 14.45/65 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 was quoted at 14.65/95 percent down from closing at 14.75/85 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 was quoted at 15.10/50 percent down from closing at 15.20/50 percent. (Colombo/July28/2023)
